group_1.narration: "How could your hair be so stiff?@What are you, a wild boar?!"
"Hey, I've never had it combed out@like this before!"
―Tsuyu―@There, the comb is finally starting to go through…!@I thought I'd have to go through about ten of them.
―Tsuyu―@But your hair is so beautiful when you get down to it.@You ought to take proper care of it.
―Chizuru―@Before we get into any of that, is it all clean now?
―Tsuyu―@Yes, it has such beautiful luster to it.
―Chizuru―@Hey, tell me another story later―@The Chronicle of the Future.
―Tsuyu―@It's one where Ushiwakamaru travels to the world@of the Tengu and inquires about his future…

group_1.textLeft: Wow, they've really gotten close, huh.

group_1.textRight: It's like they're real sisters…
But even if the entire Kamihama region rallies@around Mizuna after this,
those two will…

group_1.textLeft: Yeah, they'll clash again…

group_1.textRight: Recklessly changing that sequence of history@would be the epitome of foolishness.

group_1.textLeft: [chara:100301:effect_emotion_surprise_0][se:7226_shock]Mmph?!
I-I know that…!
…Still, I wonder what'll happen to them@after this…

group_1.textRight: The rift between Mizuna and Taito deepens@once more and they come apart.
After losing her faith in Chizuru,@Tsuyu becomes a Witch.
Then later on, after struggling against some@other Witch, Chizuru will fall as well…

group_1.textLeft: I shouldn't have asked…
…We can't change the past.

group_1.textRight: I get there's nothing we can do about food,@but why do we all have to fight?

group_1.textLeft: The more land you have, the more food you@can grow, and the more people you can feed.

group_1.textRight: So when there's a famine going on, people@inevitably start fighting each other…

group_1.textLeft: I feel like if people were able to resist their greed@even slightly more, there would be less conflict.

group_1.textRight: Isn't it pretty to think so.

group_1.textLeft: You may enter. What do you need?

group_1.textRight: Lord Masatsuna wishes to see you.
How can I help you, Father?

group_1.textLeft: Please sit down.

group_1.textRight: Alright.

group_1.textLeft: I just received a letter that Lord Sumiya@is returning from his travels.
As anticipated, having witnessed the people's@condition, he will pass the moratorium.
I had thought he was just a cowardly fool@compared to his cunning predecessor,
but it seems like even he is capable of making@the right decision.

group_1.textRight: Excellent news. What a relief.

group_1.textLeft: Unfortunately, it's not all good.

group_1.textRight: W-what's wrong…?

group_1.textLeft: Well, you see…
Word has it that the Kosho Clan and a temple@tied to Suitoku have begun a tax collection.

group_1.textRight: How absurd! Suitoku was the first to…!

group_1.textLeft: As Taito's western neighbors, Kosho must fear retaliation.
With their troops out of commission, they need@funds to prepare new forces.

group_1.textRight: In other words, they're trying to reap the taxes@they can before the moratorium is issued…

group_1.textLeft: Indeed.
Despite his status, Lord Kosho was ousted due@to the disaster that was the attack on Taito.
The new head of the clan is but an@inexperienced young man.

group_1.textRight: I understand that…but…@why would the temple…?

group_1.textLeft: I have no idea. For now, we must focus on@containing the situation.
Since you are a Battle Shamaness, Lord Kumai@wants you to go there.

group_1.textRight: Me…?

group_1.textLeft: Their forces are gone, so they want to dispatch@someone who can match a small standing army.
Gen'un of Suitoku is also deploying troops@to investigate the situation.
I'm sorry to put this on you, but will you go?

group_1.textRight: Of course.
